title: TC001-Sign in with valid credentials and reach dashboard
description: Verifies a user can sign in with email/password and is taken to the dashboard.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None

    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()

        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )

        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)

        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()

        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Navigate to http://localhost:5173
        await page.goto("http://localhost:5173", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # -> Type the provided email into the email input (index 7), then type the provided password into the password input (index 8), then click the 'Sign in' button (index 11).
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input text
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div/div/div[2]/div[2]/form/div[1]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('sdisha2003@gmail.com')
        
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input text
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div/div/div[2]/div[2]/form/div[2]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('dotnet18')
        
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div/div/div[2]/div[2]/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        assert '/dashboard' in frame.url
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Dashboard').first).to_be_visible(timeout=3000)
        await asyncio.sleep(5)

    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()

asyncio.run(run_test())

        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)

        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()

        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow

        await page.goto("http://localhost:5173", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # -> Input the test email into the email field (index 10).
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input text
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div/div/div[2]/div[2]/form/div[1]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('sdisha2003@gmail.com')
        
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input text
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div/div/div[2]/div[2]/form/div[2]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('dotnet18')
        
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div/div/div[2]/div[2]/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        # -> Click the 'Drift' button (index 341) to navigate to the protected /drift route, then verify the URL contains '/drift'.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div/div/div/aside/nav/button[2]').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Verify that the user was redirected to the dashboard after sign in
        assert "/dashboard" in frame.url
        
        # Verify navigation to the protected /drift route
        assert "/drift" in frame.url
        
        # Check that a page element from the Drift page is visible (Back to Journal button)
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div[1]/div/header/button')
        assert await elem.is_visible()
        await asyncio.sleep(5)

    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()

asyncio.run(run_test())
